channel.title: I-Bot Section (or Child-Board?)
channel.description:
[center][b][i][u][size=20pt]Proposition[/size][/u][/i][/b][/center]
[center][b][u][size=15pt]Details[/size][/u][/b][/center]
Well, I propose having an I-Bot section of the forums, or at least having an I-Bot child board. In the end it's up to Mopar, Algas, Star, and Ruler, but I think it would be a good addition to the forums. The boards could be I-Bot Discussion, I-Bot Help/Questions, I-Bot Scripts, I-Bot Randoms, and maybe I-Bot Development (dunno how many people would help out here, so maybe it should just be a child board under the Discussion one.
[center][b][u][size=15pt]Why?[/size][/u][/b][/center]
To be honest, the I-Bot community is becoming a ghost town (just currently though; don't take this as me saying it's not getting back up). When IMPsoft was still up, I-Bot was released publicly and within a week new scripts were being released and a helpful community was being formed. Ruler made a temp. site, but because of problems with the free host, it died. I think it would greatly benefit I-Bot and the Mopar community if we opened an I-Bot section here. I think it would work well seeing as there's many members here who know Java (the scripting language used by I-Bot BTW). Also, this would give I-Bot the push it needs to get it up and rolling, and might introduce some good new members to the I-Bot community.
[center]Please post your opinions, but remember to think 'em out rather than posting pure ramble.[/center]
[center][b][u][i][size=15pt]FAQ[/size][/i][/u]:
Q: [i]OMFG j00 r t3h dumbz0rz! 1f ib0t ge7s t3h seckshun, y n0 t3h ARGA sexion?!?!?! [/i] A: Because ARGA isn't public, dipshit. :P
Q: [i]How would you ensure that there would be enough active members in the new sections?[/i]
A: Simply, you can't. The best way to see if this would work out would be to make the sections and see how they go for a while; if there's no activity, then they could be removed.[/b][/center]
[center][i][b]Feel free to post something you think deserves to be in the FAQ.[/b][/i][/center]
Thanks for thinking this through and reading through it. ;)
~Sepranem~
"May all your camels be fertile."

item.title: I-Bot Section (or Child-Board?)
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

I’m afraid of I-Bot… because that means us Scar Scripters aren’t the shit anymore :x. [or at least not as much so]

Read full topic

item.title: I-Bot Section (or Child-Board?)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I voted yes, mainly to get more people intrested. At the end of the day though, it’s down to mopar and ruler/any other moparisthebest admin that might have his/her views.

Each day I’m becomming more and more intrested in i-Bot. SCAR will always remain the backbone of cheating, but as a scar scripter I tell you that writing a good to flawless SCAR script requires alot of work, I haven’t tryed i-Bot yet, and would like to see how diffrent scripting is to achieve the same thing. (IE, will i-Bot be less work more lines, less lines more work, will it be more reliable?)

Read full topic

item.description:
@ruler wrote:

We are up ut raw is still attacking, i dk i am evaulating some options.

[quote=“Pwnd, post:12, topic:17797”]I am a mod, so shhh ;O

Also, yeah, iBot ftl for multiplatforming.[/quote]
is it multip platform, everyone that has gotten it working on linux has neglected to post a tut. It is assumed linux ppl understand bash scripts and can

Take these

eclipse.org

SWT: The Standard Widget Toolkit | The Eclipse Foundation

The Eclipse Foundation - home to a global community, the Eclipse IDE, Jakarta EE and over 350 open source projects, including runtimes, tools and frameworks.


get linux .so’s and put in java/bin

Classpath wont help bc i take over the jvm before classpaths are in the lib path.[br][size=1]Posted at: October 10, 2006, 07:59:05 PM[/size][hr][quote=“sppt, post:5, topic:17797”]impsoft is back up, but i would have said no anyways![/quote]

[center][size=15pt]Details[/size][/center]

Well, I propose having an I-Bot section of the forums, or at least having an I-Bot child board.
